text: Brooklyn Heights was New York's first
Historic Landmark District it's quiet

quaint Victorian neighborhood where time
has Stood Still that's a bit misleading
with the streets don't let on is that

workers artists eccentrics and a famous
burlesque Queen the height stretches

over to cadman plaza west in court
street for much of the 1800s it was a
wealthy and exclusive suburb one of its
most handsome buildings preserves that
era inside and out the home of the
Brooklyn Historical Society the building
was built in 1881 by George bpost who
was best known actually as the architect
of the New York Stock Exchange he was
inspired by this kind of wonderful
combination of very Victorian 19th

very interested in fairly modern
engineering and in fact he was inspired
by the building of the Brooklyn Bridge
that was going on Elsa right next door

customs
used to send agents out there are fears
